COMPLIANCE WITH THE EU DIGITAL SERVICES ACT (DSA)

Last updated: 2026-01-16

In accordance with Regulation (EU) 2022/2065 (the “Digital Services Act” or “DSA”), we provide the information below about the average monthly active recipients of our service in the European Union, where applicable, and explain how users and authorities can contact us and submit notices regarding illegal content.

1) AVERAGE MONTHLY ACTIVE RECIPIENTS IN THE EU

Service/provider: WhiteKnight Academy (operated by TheBroda sp. z o.o.)

1.1 DSA reporting (historical metric)

The DSA metric refers to the average monthly active recipients in the EU calculated over a rolling period of the past six (6) months based on actual usage. We will publish and update the historical DSA metric once we have sufficient operational data and thereafter review/update it at least every six months.

  • Historical measurement period (past 6 months): [to be updated]
  • Average monthly active recipients in the EU (historical): [to be updated]

1.2 Forward-looking estimate (projection for planning)

The figures below are a projection (forward-looking estimate) for internal planning and roadmap purposes. They are not presented as the final historical DSA metric. When the period becomes historical and the data is verified, we will update the historical metric above accordingly.

  • Measurement period (projection / planned): 2026-01-16 to 2026-06-15
  • Average monthly active recipients in the EU (projection): 30

Methodology (high level):

  • We calculate the monthly number of active recipients in the EU by counting unique individuals located in the EU who actively used our service in each month (registered or not).
  • We then compute an average across the relevant 6-month period.
  • Where feasible, we aim to avoid double-counting across interfaces/domains and to exclude automated/bot activity.

We review and update this information at least once every six months.

2) DSA SINGLE POINT OF CONTACT

If you need to contact us regarding DSA-related matters (e.g., notices, complaints, appeals, or legal requests), please use the contact details below.

  • Email: contact@whiteknight.academy
  • Languages: English, Polish, Ukrainian

Note: This email is intended as a single point of contact for DSA-related communication for both users and EU authorities.

3) NOTICES / REPORTING CONTENT (WHERE APPLICABLE)

Our Service may enable users to submit or publish content (including public user-generated content). If you wish to report content that you believe is illegal or violates our policies, please email: contact@whiteknight.academy.

To help us process your notice, please include:

  • The exact location of the content (URL and/or screenshot).
  • A clear explanation of why you believe the content is illegal (and in which country, if relevant).
  • Your name and email address (unless you are submitting anonymously where permitted).
  • A good-faith statement confirming that the information in your notice is accurate and complete to the best of your knowledge.

We may request additional information where needed to assess the notice. We aim to review notices in a timely manner.

For more information about our rules and acceptable use, please see: Terms of Service.

4) CONTENT MODERATION, STATEMENT OF REASONS, AND APPEALS

We may take moderation actions such as removing or restricting access to content, limiting visibility, or suspending accounts where necessary to enforce our rules, protect users, and comply with applicable laws.

Where required, we aim to provide affected users with a clear statement of reasons for certain moderation decisions.

Appeals / internal complaints:

If you wish to contest a moderation decision, you may contact us at contact@whiteknight.academy with the subject line: “DSA Appeal / Complaint” and include:

  • the URL(s) of the content or account affected,
  • a brief description of the decision you are contesting,
  • the reasons you believe the decision was incorrect, and
  • any supporting information (if available).

We review complaints in a timely manner and may request additional information to complete the review.

5) TRANSPARENCY REPORTING

We aim to publish transparency information about our content moderation activities in line with the DSA. Our transparency reporting page (once available) will be published here: DSA Transparency Report.
